paper_title.ja: Absorption, translocation and metabolism of bisphenol A, a possible endocrine disruptor, in rice seedlings
paper_title.en: Absorption, Translocation and Metabolism of Bisphenol A, a Possible Endocrine Disruptor, in Rice Seedlings

description.ja: イネ幼苗は内分泌撹乱作用物質と考えられるビスフェノールA (BPA) を速やかに吸収し, 水質を浄化した.BPA添加養液で栽培したイネ幼苗を経時的に収穫し, エタノール洗浄による根表面, メタノール抽出による根と地上部 (茎葉部) に存在するBPAをHPLCで定量したところ, BPAは根より吸収され, 地上部に転送されることが判明した.植物体からBPAの回収率が低かったので, 重水素化したBPAを吸収させ, 根と地上部に存在する代謝物を<SUP>2</SUP>H-NMR測定で検索した.BPAに換算して, メタノールで抽出できる代謝物量は投与量の約5%, 酸あるいはアルカリによる加水分解で遊離する代謝物量は約25%で, 残り (約70%) は, 上述の加水分解条件では遊離しない重合体あるいは植物体との結合を形成すると判断された.可溶化した代謝物の<SUP>2</SUP>H-NMR分析から, 吸収されたビスフェノールAの一部は酸化あるいは炭素骨格の変換等によって代謝されると推定された.
description.en: Rice seedlings quickly absorbed bisphenol A (BPA), a possible endocrine disruptor, in culture medium, indicating that they are capable of improving water quality. Measurements of BPA extracted from roots with the stem base and leaves/stems indicated that BPA was translocated from the roots to the top of the plants. The recovery rate by MeOH extraction was very low even during the absorption period, indicating that BPA is not bioaccumulated in the seedlings. The roots and tops of the rice seedlings cultured in the medium containing deuterium-labeled BPA, [2H] BPA, were extracted with MeOH and hydrolyzed with HC1 and NaOH. The extracts and the hydrolyzates were analyzed by 2HNMR. The spectral data indicated that about 5% of the metabolites, as [2H] BPA equivalents, was found in the MeOH extracts and ca. 25% in the acidic and alkaline hydrolyzates. The rest (ca. 70%) could be polymerized and/or bound in the tissues as insoluble, unhydrolyzable forms. The signals in the 2H-NMR spectra of the extracts and the hydrolyzates indicated that BPA was metabolized by oxidation and skeletal rearrangement to several compounds.

publisher.ja: Japanese Society of Agricultural, Biological and Environmental Engineers and Scientists
publisher.en: Japanese Society of Agricultural, Biological and Environmental Engineers and Scientists

ja.name: ヌレディン M.イマデディン

description.en: Rice seedlings quickly absorbed bisphenol A (BPA), a possible endocrine disruptor, in culture medium, indicating that they are capable of improving water quality. Measurements of BPA extracted from roots with the stem base and leaves/stems indicated that BPA was translocated from the roots to the top of the plants. The spectral data indicated that about 5% of the metabolites, as [2H] BPA equivalents, was found in the MeOH extracts and ca. 25% in the acidic and alkaline hydrolyzates. The rest (ca. 70%) could be polymerized and/or bound in the tissues as insoluble, unhydrolyzable forms. The signals in the 2H-NMR spectra of the extracts and the hydrolyzates indicated that BPA was metabolized by oxidation and skeletal rearrangement to several compounds.

paper_title.en: Anthrasesamones from roots of Sesamum indicum

description.en: Three anthraquinones, named anthrasesamones A, B and C, were isolated from the roots of Sesarnum indicum, and their respective structures were determined to be 1-hydroxy-2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone, 1,4-dihydroxy-2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone and 2-chloro-1,4-dihydroxy-3-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone on the basis of spectroscopic evidence. Two known anthraquitiones were also isolated for the first time from S. indicum roots and characterized as 2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone and (E)-2-(4-methylpenta-1,3-dienyl)anthraquinone. Anthrasesamone C is a rare chlorinated anthraquinone in higher plants. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Anthrasesamones from roots of Sesamum indicum

description.en: Three anthraquinones, named anthrasesamones A, B and C, were isolated from the roots of Sesarnum indicum, and their respective structures were determined to be 1-hydroxy-2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone, 1,4-dihydroxy-2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone and 2-chloro-1,4-dihydroxy-3-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone on the basis of spectroscopic evidence. Two known anthraquitiones were also isolated for the first time from S. indicum roots and characterized as 2-(4-methylpent-3-enyl)anthraquinone and (E)-2-(4-methylpenta-1,3-dienyl)anthraquinone. Anthrasesamone C is a rare chlorinated anthraquinone in higher plants. (C) 2003 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Evaluation of plants for absorbing nitrogen and phosphorus to purify eutrophic water
paper_title.en: Evaluation of Plants for Absorbing Nitrogen and Phosphorus to Purify Eutrophic Water

description.ja: The capability of higher plants to improve the quality of artificial wastewater (Otsuka-House Fertilizer Series A medium, 0.5 dS m<SUP>-1</SUP>) varied with the species and with the growth conditions. In the warm season, water convolvulus showed more activity than mint, jute or water hyacinth (a plant widely used against eutrophication). In the cold season, calla lily showed the highest level of activity. Thus, the plant species need to be selected depending on the season. Water convolvulus is a green leaf vegetable with medicinal value, and calla lily is an ornamental plant. Both plants can be effectively used to improve water quality and as useful resources after harvest.
description.en: The capability of higher plants to improve the quality of artificial wastewater (Otsuka-House Fertilizer Series A medium, 0.5 dS m<SUP>-1</SUP>) varied with the species and with the growth conditions. In the warm season, water convolvulus showed more activity than mint, jute or water hyacinth (a plant widely used against eutrophication). In the cold season, calla lily showed the highest level of activity. Thus, the plant species need to be selected depending on the season. Water convolvulus is a green leaf vegetable with medicinal value, and calla lily is an ornamental plant. Both plants can be effectively used to improve water quality and as useful resources after harvest.
